(In reply to comment #2)
Yes, it is. The problem only occurs in Linux while windows doesn't have this 
problem.

> Raymond,
> since you mention it in the summary, is RHEL significant here? That is, does 
> this problem not occur on Windows?

I tried the scenario with Raymond in his RHEL 4 update 1 machine.  The UDDI 
registry came up no problem with the latest driver.

As we are trying to close down WTP 1.5, please get the latest WTP 1.5 driver to verify the bug and reopen if the problem had not been fixed.  If this defect is not verified/reopened by end of day 06/16, I'll attempt to verify the defect by reproducing the problem as described in the defect.  However, since you know your scenario best, it would be more appropriate if you verify the fix.
Since there's no response from the originator for almost a year, closing this defect on behalf of the originator.
